    • Constructor Detail

      • StaticMesh

        public StaticMesh​(float[] vertex)
        Constructs static mesh by copying vertex data
        Parameters:
        vertex - vertex data

      • StaticMesh

        public StaticMesh​(int nVertices,
                  float[] coordinates)
        Constructs static mesh. The vertices of the mesh are created from a coordinates array. The first three coordinates are the first vertex, the next three coordinates are the second vertex etc.
        Parameters:
        nVertices - number of vertices that should be build out of the coordinates array
        coordinates - array of x,y,z coordinates of the vertices

      • StaticMesh

        public StaticMesh​(OBJGroup group)
        Constructs static mesh. The vertices come from the Object Loader (import interface for maya files)
        Parameters:
        group - Object Loader result, containing vertices

      • StaticMesh

        public StaticMesh​(Vec3Array verts)

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Description copied from class: AbstMeshData
        Clone method must be implemented in each derived class
        Overrides:
        clone in class AbstMeshData

      • updateWorldData

        public boolean updateWorldData()
        Updates internal data for new frame. The object will update its internal data. This data is considered to be consistent for the duration of (at least) ohne frame; thus the application can pass consecutive frame numbers, which in turn can be used by the object to prevent multiple recalculations, should this function be called more than once per frame. A frame number of -1 will enforce recalculation in every case.
        Specified by:
        updateWorldData in class AbstMeshData
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether the mesh data changed since the previous call to this function

      • baseMesh

        public StaticMesh baseMesh()
        Returns the base mesh data object. This function can be used to traverse hierarchies of mesh data objects. In the case of an object that has several mesh data objects as inputs, one of these meshes is considered to be the primary mesh, which is returned by this function.
        Specified by:
        baseMesh in class AbstMeshData
        Returns:
        base mesh object, or 0
